1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: POPUP.C Fri 10-27-2000 9:40:58 pm HvA V2.01 $
3    | 
4    | DESC: Popup menu routines for HVA_WIN
5    | 
6    | HIST: 19900818 V0.01 - Initial version                         
7    | 	  19910727 V0.02 - Adapted for new window routines (wn_...)
8    | 	  19911119 V0.03 - Added directory pick routine            
9    | 	  20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for DJGPP
10   | ***************************************************************************/
11   | 
12   | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13   |                         HEADER FILES
14   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
15   | #include <stdio.h>
16   | #include <stdlib.h>
17   | #include <string.h>
18   | #include <ctype.h>
19   | #include <dos.h>
20   | #include "video/v_video.h"
21   | #include "keys.h"
22   | #include "window.h"
23   | 
24   | /* Dynamic memory handling shell */
25   | /*
26   | #include <mshell.h>
27   | */
28   | 
29   | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
30   |                         PROTOTYPES
31   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
32   | char *void_sprintf(char *datastr, char *format, void *data);
33   | void void_sscanf(char *str, char *format, void *data);
34   | 
35   | /*==============================================================================
36   |                         START OF FUNCTIONS
37   | ==============================================================================*/
38   | 
39   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------
40   |     FUNCTION: do_action()
41   |      PURPOSE: Perform action if a item is selected by a hotkey or
42   |               by <ENTER>
43   |  DESCRIPTION: -
44   |      RETURNS: nothing
45   |      HISTORY: 28-Aug-1992 10:00:00 V0.1 - Initial version
46   |               02-Jan-1993 16:13:09 V0.2 - New flag: EDIT_STR.
47   |                                           Deleted NO_EDIT flag.
48   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------*/
49   | void do_action(MENU *menu, int i)
50   | {
51   |   char datastr[80], *s;
52   | 
53   |   /*---------------------------------------
54   |     Toggle a BOOLEAN value
55   |   ---------------------------------------*/
56   |   if (menu[i].flags & SELECTABLE) {
57   |     if (menu[i].data == FALSE)
58   |       menu[i].data = (void *) TRUE;
59   |     else
60   |       menu[i].data = (void *) FALSE;
61   |     return;
62   |   }
63   | 
64   |   /*---------------------------------------
65   |     Edit a string
66   |   ---------------------------------------*/
67   |   if (menu[i].data != NULL
68   |   && (menu[i].format != NULL)
69   |   && (menu[i].flags & EDIT_STR)) {
70   |     s = void_sprintf(datastr,menu[i].format,menu[i].data);
71   |     if (s) {
72   |       editstr(action_row+2,action_col+2,30,menu[i].header,datastr,_DRAW);
73   |       void_sscanf(datastr,menu[i].format,menu[i].data);
74   |       return;
75   |     }
76   |   }
77   | 
78   |   /*---------------------------------------
79   |     Enter help functions if HELP_ONLY
80   |   ---------------------------------------*/
81   |   if (menu[i].flags & HELP_ONLY)
82   |   {
83   |     help(menu[i].help);
84   |     return;
85   |   }
86   | 
87   |   /*---------------------------------------------
88   |     If a function was defined, perform function
89   |   -----------------------------------------------*/
90   |   if (menu[i].function != NULL)
91   |   {
92   |     (*(PFI)(menu[i].function))();
93   |     return;
94   |   }
95   | 
96   | }
97   | 
98   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------
99   |    FUNCTION: popup()
100  |     PURPOSE: Make and react on a popup menu
101  |  DESRIPTION: This function creates an popup menu with text and
102  |              values of referenced data. The upperleft corner of
103  |              the popup menu is (row,col)
104  |     RETURNS: Hot-key of selected item if available, else
105  |              the number (0...number-1) of the item selected,
106  |              If ESC is pressed, ESC is returned.
107  |     VERSION: 910828 V0.6
108  |              12-Oct-1993 V0.7 - wn_open() now uses size of external window
109  |                                 (incl. borders) -> adapted size of
110  |                                 popupwindow.
111  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------*/
112  | unsigned int popup(int  number,     /* Number of menu items                   */
113  |           MENU *menu,      /* Pointer to an array of MENU structures */
114  |           int row,         /* Upper row for the menu                 */
115  |           int col )        /* Left column for the menu               */
116  | {
117  |   int i,mlen;
118  |   unsigned int key = ARROW_DOWN;    /* Default key */
119  |   WINDOW *popup_window;
120  |   char datastr[132], *s;
121  |   static int select = 0, old_select = 0;
122  |   static MENU *oldmenu = NULL;
123  |   static int autorow = FALSE;
124  |   static int last_row = 0;
125  |   static int autocol = FALSE;
126  |   static int last_col = 0;
127  | 
128  |   wn_log("START POPUP()\n");
129  |   wn_log_indent(+2);
130  | 
131  |   /*---------------------------------------
132  |     Determine row
133  |   ---------------------------------------*/
134  |   if (row == AUTO_ROW) {
135  |     if (!autorow) {
136  |       row = action_row;
137  |       last_row = action_row;
138  |       autorow = TRUE;
139  |     }
140  |     else {
141  |       row = last_row;
142  |     }
143  |   }
144  |   else {
145  |     autorow = FALSE;
146  |     last_row = row;
147  |   }
148  | 
149  |   /*---------------------------------------
150  |     Determine column
151  |   ---------------------------------------*/
152  |   if (col == AUTO_COL) {
153  |     if (!autocol) {
154  |       col = action_col;
155  |       last_col = action_col;
156  |       autocol = TRUE;
157  |     }
158  |     else {
159  |       col = last_col;
160  |     }
161  |   }
162  |   else {
163  |     autocol = FALSE;
164  |     last_col = col;
165  |   }
166  | 
167  | 
168  |   /*---------------------------------------
169  |     Fill menu strings with data
170  |   ---------------------------------------*/
171  |   for (i=0 ; i<number ; i++)
172  |   {
173  |     menu[i].string[0] = '\0';
174  |     strcpy(menu[i].string,menu[i].header);  /* Copy 'header' to 'string' */
175  |     s = void_sprintf(datastr,menu[i].format,menu[i].data);
176  |     if (s)
177  |     {
178  |       strcat(menu[i].string,"  ");      /* Add blanks  */
179  |       strcat(menu[i].string,datastr);   /* Add 'datastr' to 'string' */
180  |     }
181  |   }
182  | 
183  |   /*-----------------------------------
184  |     Determine the maximum line length
185  |   ------------------------------------*/
186  |   mlen = 0;
187  |   for (i=0 ; i<number ; i++)
188  |     mlen = max(mlen,strlen(menu[i].string));
189  | 
190  |   /*------------------------------------------------------------
191  |     Open the window and print the items
192  |     12-Oct-1993 V0.7: Add 2 for xsize to include window borders
193  |   -------------------------------------------------------------*/
194  |   popup_window = wn_open(_SINGLE_LINE, row, col, mlen+2, number+2,
195  |                     _menu_att, _border_att);
196  |   row = popup_window->y1;
197  |   col = popup_window->x1;
198  | 
199  |   wn_log("printing popup menu items:\n");
200  |   for (i=0 ; i<number ; i++)
201  |   {
202  |     if (menu[i].flags & COMMENT)
203  |       hotstring(row+i,col,-1,menu[i].string,_comment_att);
204  |     else if (menu[i].flags & DISABLED)
205  |       hotstring(row+i,col,-1,menu[i].string,_disabled_att);
206  |     else
207  |       hotstring(row+i,col,menu[i].hotkey,menu[i].string,_menu_att);
208  |   }
209  | 
210  |   /*-------------------------------------------------------
211  |     If it is the same menu as last time, we use the last
212  |     selected item to highlight
213  |   -------------------------------------------------------*/
214  |   if (menu == oldmenu)
215  |   {
216  |     select = ++select % number;
217  |     old_select = select;
218  |   }
219  |   else
220  |   {
221  |     select = 0;
222  |     old_select = 0;
223  |     oldmenu = menu;
224  |   }
225  | 
226  |   while(TRUE)
227  |   {
228  |     /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
229  |       Reset attribute of old selected line.
230  |       Don't do this when the item is a COMMENT or when it is DISABLED
231  |     --------------------------------------------------------------------*/
232  |     if (!(menu[old_select].flags & (COMMENT|DISABLED))) {
233  |       v_setattrib_area(row+old_select,col,mlen,1,_menu_att);
234  |       hotstring(row+old_select,col,
235  |         menu[old_select].hotkey,menu[old_select].string,_menu_att);
236  |     }
237  | 
238  |     /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
239  |       Set attribute of new selected line.
240  |       Don't do this when the item is a COMMENT or when it is DISABLED
241  |     --------------------------------------------------------------------*/
242  |     if (!(menu[select].flags & (COMMENT|DISABLED))) {
243  |       action_row = row+select;
244  |       action_col = col;
245  |       v_setattrib_area(action_row,action_col,mlen,1,_menu_highlight);
246  |     }
247  | 
248  |     if (!(menu[select].flags & (COMMENT|DISABLED)))
249  |       key = waitkey();		  /*--- Scancode is returned here  */
250  | 
251  |     if (is_fkey(key)) {
252  |       switch(key) {
253  |         case F1:  help(menu[select].help); break;
254  |         default:  do_funkey(key); break;
255  |       }
256  |     }
257  | 
258  |     /*-----------------------------------------------
259  |       If hotkey defined, make this the new key value
260  |     ------------------------------------------------*/
261  |     switch(key) {
262  |       case ENTER:
263  |         if (menu[select].hotkey != -1)
264  |           key = menu[select].header[menu[select].hotkey];
265  |         break;
266  |       default:
267  |         break;
268  |     }
269  | 
270  |     switch(key) {
271  |       /*----------------------
272  |       | Up- and down arrow
273  |       -----------------------*/
274  |       case ARROW_UP:
275  | 	    wn_log("ARROW_UP\n");
276  |         old_select = select;
277  |         select = (--select+number) % number;
278  |         break;
279  | 
280  |       case ARROW_DOWN:
281  | 	    wn_log("ARROW_DOWN\n");
282  |         old_select = select;
283  |         select = ++select % number;
284  |         break;
285  | 
286  |       /*--------------------------------------
287  |       | No hotkey defined for this popup menu
288  |       ----------------------------------------*/
289  |       case ENTER:
290  | 	    wn_log("ENTER\n");
291  |         if (menu[select].flags & EXIT) {
292  |           wn_log_indent(-2);
293  |           wn_log("END POPUP()\n");
294  |           popup_window = wn_close(popup_window);   /* Close it before actions */
295  |         }
296  |         do_action(menu,select);
297  |         wn_log_indent(-2);
298  |         wn_log("END POPUP()\n");
299  |         popup_window = wn_close(popup_window);
300  |         return(select);           /* Return number of selected item [0,...> */
301  | 
302  |       /*----------------------
303  |       | Escape from popup()
304  |       ----------------------*/
305  |       case ESC_KEY:
306  |       case ARROW_LEFT:
307  |       case ARROW_RIGHT:
308  | 	    wn_log("ESC or ARROW_LEFT or ARROW_RIGHT\n");
309  |         wn_log_indent(-2);
310  |         wn_log("END POPUP()\n");
311  |         popup_window = wn_close(popup_window);
312  |         return(key);
313  | 
314  |       default:
315  | 	    wn_log("OTHER KEY\n");
316  | 		key = key & 0x00FF;	
317  |         if (key > 31 && key < 128) {
318  |           for (i=0 ; i<number ; i++) {
319  |             if (toupper(key) == toupper(menu[i].header[menu[i].hotkey])) {
320  |               if (menu[i].flags & EXIT) {
321  |                 wn_log_indent(-2);
322  |                 wn_log("END POPUP()\n");
323  |                 popup_window = wn_close(popup_window);
324  |               }
325  |               do_action(menu,i);
326  |               wn_log_indent(-2);
327  |               wn_log("END POPUP()\n");
328  |               popup_window = wn_close(popup_window);
329  |               return(toupper(key));
330  |             }
331  |           }
332  |         } /* if (key ...) */
333  |     } /* switch(key) */
334  |   } /* while (TRUE) */
335  | 
336  |   if (key == ENTER)
337  |     return(select);
338  |   else if (key == ESC_KEY)
339  |     return(ESC);
340  |   else
341  |     return(toupper(key));
342  | }
343  | 
